intro: Athroandra, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like blooms with yellow centers and white or pink petals. Athroandra species typically grow in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
